segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 7
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 7

segments.pli: 6. Abyākatavagga
segments.en: 6. The Undeclared Points

segments.pli: 54. Abyākatasutta
segments.en: 54. The Undeclared Points

segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo yena sutavato ariyasāvakassa vicikicchā nuppajjati abyākatavatthūsū”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why an educated noble disciple has no doubts regarding the undeclared points?”

segments.pli: “Diṭṭhinirodhā kho, bhikkhu, sutavato ariyasāvakassa vicikicchā nuppajjati abyākatavatthūsu.
segments.en: “Mendicant, it’s due to the cessation of views that an educated noble disciple has no doubts regarding the undeclared points.

segments.pli: ‘Hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, diṭṭhigatametaṃ;
segments.en: ‘A Realized One exists after death’: this is a misconception.

segments.pli: ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, diṭṭhigatametaṃ;
segments.en: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death’: this is a misconception.

segments.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, diṭṭhigatametaṃ;
segments.en: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’: this is a misconception.

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, diṭṭhigatametaṃ.
segments.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’: this is a misconception.

segments.pli: Assutavā, bhikkhu, puthujjano diṭṭhiṃ nappajānāti, diṭṭhisamudayaṃ nappajānāti, diṭṭhinirodhaṃ nappajānāti, diṭṭhinirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: An uneducated ordinary person doesn’t understand views, their origin, their cessation, or the practice that leads to their cessation.

segments.pli: Tassa sā diṭṭhi pavaḍḍhati, so na parimuccati jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, na parimuccati dukkhasmāti vadāmi.
segments.en: And so their views grow. They’re not freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress. They’re not freed from suffering, I say.

segments.pli: Sutavā ca kho, bhikkhu, ariyasāvako diṭṭhiṃ pajānāti, diṭṭhisamudayaṃ pajānāti, diṭṭhinirodhaṃ pajānāti, diṭṭhinirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: An educated noble disciple does understand views, their origin, their cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation.

segments.pli: Tassa sā diṭṭhi nirujjhati, so parimuccati jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, parimuccati dukkhasmāti vadāmi.
segments.en: And so their views cease. They’re freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress. They’re freed from suffering, I say.

segments.pli: Evaṃ jānaṃ kho, bhikkhu, sutavā ariyasāvako evaṃ passaṃ ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipi na byākaroti;
segments.en: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not answer: ‘A Realized One exists after death’,

segments.pli: ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipi na byākaroti;
segments.en: ‘a Realized One doesn’t exist after death’,

segments.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipi na byākaroti;
segments.en: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’,

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipi na byākaroti.
segments.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ jānaṃ kho, bhikkhu, sutavā ariyasāvako evaṃ passaṃ evaṃ abyākaraṇadhammo hoti abyākatavatthūsu.
segments.en: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not declare the undeclared points.

segments.pli: Evaṃ jānaṃ kho, bhikkhu, sutavā ariyasāvako evaṃ passaṃ na chambhati, na kampati, na vedhati, na santāsaṃ āpajjati abyākatavatthūsu.
segments.en: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple doesn’t shake, tremble, quake, or become nervous regarding the undeclared points.

segments.pli: ‘Hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, taṇhāgatametaṃ … pe …
segments.en: ‘A Realized One exists after death’: this is just about craving. …

segments.pli: saññāgatametaṃ … pe …
segments.en: it’s just about perception …

segments.pli: maññitametaṃ … pe …
segments.en: it’s an identification …

segments.pli: papañcitametaṃ … pe …
segments.en: it’s a proliferation …

segments.pli: upādānagatametaṃ … pe …
segments.en: it’s just about grasping …

segments.pli: ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, vippaṭisāro eso;
segments.en: ‘A Realized One exists after death’: this is a regret.

segments.pli: ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, vippaṭisāro eso;
segments.en: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death’: this is a regret.

segments.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, vippaṭisāro eso;
segments.en: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’: this is a regret.

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, vippaṭisāro eso.
segments.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’: this is a regret.

segments.pli: Assutavā, bhikkhu, puthujjano vippaṭisāraṃ nappajānāti, vippaṭisārasamudayaṃ nappajānāti, vippaṭisāranirodhaṃ nappajānāti, vippaṭisāranirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: An uneducated ordinary person doesn’t understand regrets, their origin, their cessation, or the practice that leads to their cessation.

segments.pli: Tassa so vippaṭisāro pavaḍḍhati, so na parimuccati jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi, na parimuccati dukkhasmāti vadāmi.
segments.en: And so their regrets grow. They’re not freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress. They’re not freed from suffering, I say.

segments.pli: Sutavā ca kho, bhikkhu, ariyasāvako vippaṭisāraṃ pajānāti, vippaṭisārasamudayaṃ pajānāti, vippaṭisāranirodhaṃ pajānāti, vippaṭisāranirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: An educated noble disciple does understand regrets, their origin, their cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation.

segments.pli: Tassa so vippaṭisāro nirujjhati, so parimuccati jātiyā … pe … dukkhasmāti vadāmi.
segments.en: And so their regrets cease. They’re freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress. They’re freed from suffering, I say.

segments.pli: Evaṃ jānaṃ kho, bhikkhu, sutavā ariyasāvako evaṃ passaṃ ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipi na byākaroti … pe …
segments.en: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not answer: ‘A Realized One exists after death’ …

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipi na byākaroti.
segments.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ jānaṃ kho, bhikkhu, sutavā ariyasāvako evaṃ passaṃ evaṃ abyākaraṇadhammo hoti abyākatavatthūsu.
segments.en: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not declare the undeclared points.

segments.pli: Evaṃ jānaṃ kho, bhikkhu, sutavā ariyasāvako evaṃ passaṃ na chambhati, na kampati, na vedhati, na santāsaṃ āpajjati abyākatavatthūsu.
segments.en: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple doesn’t shake, tremble, quake, or become nervous regarding the undeclared points.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhu, hetu ayaṃ paccayo yena sutavato ariyasāvakassa vicikicchā nuppajjati abyākatavatthūsū”ti.
segments.en: This is the cause, this is the reason why an educated noble disciple has no doubts regarding the undeclared points.”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.
